title: Colombia declares emergency over yellow fever outbreak
summary: Colombian health authorities have declared a public health emergency due to an outbreak of yellow fever, a serious viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes.
content:
Colombian officials have announced a state of emergency following the detection of multiple yellow fever cases in the country. The mosquito-borne disease, which can cause severe symptoms including fever, muscle pain, and in some cases organ failure, has prompted health authorities to take immediate action.

The emergency declaration enables the mobilization of additional resources and implementation of preventive measures, including intensified vaccination campaigns in affected regions. Health officials are urging residents to take precautions against mosquito bites and ensure their yellow fever vaccinations are up to date.

The outbreak has raised concerns particularly in rural and forested areas where the disease-carrying mosquitoes are more prevalent.
